basics.name: Alberto Espinosa de los Monteros
basics.summary: Detail-oriented with a strong focus on software engineering and AI. Experienced in developing scalable, high-performance systems through full-stack development, API design, and machine learning integration. Passionate about writing clean, maintainable code and contributing to teams that build impactful, user-focused technology.

education.institution: The University of Colorado at Boulder

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary:
Recognized for academic excellence and outstanding performance in coursework. 

 Achieved Dean's List status for the following semesters: 

 Fall 2020, Spring 2021, Fall 2021, Spring 2024, Fall 2024, and Spring 2025.

awards.title: CU Boulder BOLD Scholar
awards.summary: Selected for the BOLD program, promoting professional development among Hispanic students in STEM.

awards.title: Ted Sizer Award
awards.summary: Recognized for outstanding leadership and commitment to the school's values and community.

awards.title: Summit Foundation Award
awards.summary: Awarded for academic excellence and community service during high school.

work.name: Global Healthcare Exchange (GHX)
work.summary: Contracted to lead development of an AI-driven system combining rule-based logic and LLMs for medical product matching.
highlights: Built a hybrid Prolog + LLM product matching system to reduce manual review by over 25 hours/week.
Designed and maintained Python APIs for real-time processing with SQL, Prolog, and OpenAI models.
Deployed the system on AWS EC2 using Docker and CI/CD pipelines with secure modular architecture.

projects.name: AI-Powered Summarizer (HackCU11)
projects.summary: Built a real-time lecture summarizer using Flask, OpenAI Whisper, and GPT-4 in 24 hours during HackCU11.
highlights: Achieved 95%+ transcription and summarization accuracy.
Processed 25MB+ audio/video files in <10 seconds.
Engineered robust backend pipelines and UI for note review.

projects.name: AWS DeepRacer Autonomous Vehicle
projects.summary: Designed an autonomous vehicle using Raspberry Pi, LiDAR, ROS2, and camera modules for local edge-compute driving.
highlights: Boosted localization by 80% using EKF and optical flow fusion.
Implemented PID and MPC controllers to cut trajectory deviation by 60%.
Achieved smooth lap performance and control stability.

projects.name: Machine Learning for Disaster Relief in Python
projects.summary: To use historical disaster data from the EM-DAT database to predict at-risk regions and optimize disaster relief resource allocation. The project focused on analyzing disaster types, severity, and their impacts to guide data-driven decision-making.
highlights: Built ML models (Random Forest, SVM, Gradient Boosting) to predict disaster severity with up to 69% accuracy.
Developed an end-to-end ETL pipeline with imputation, feature engineering, and class balancing; led model evaluation and comparative analysis across disaster types for resource allocation.

projects.name: STM32 Board Project in C++
projects.summary: Developed a Tic-Tac-Toe game on the STM32F429i Discovery Board, integrating peripherals via HAL, external interrupts, and timers.
highlights: Designed an intuitive user interface for the game.
Created an AI opponent with RNG-based logic.
Optimized the system using STM32CubeIDE.

projects.name: UDP Client-Server Connection in C
projects.summary: Developed a UDP-based client-server system replicating core FTP functionalities, enabling file management.
highlights: Implemented reliable UDP communication with packet retransmission and error handling.
Optimized file transmission for large files.

projects.name: Distributed File System (DFS) in C++
projects.summary: Developed a distributed file system (DFS) with redundancy for secure file storage across servers.
highlights: Implemented file chunking and redundant storage for 100% file recovery.
Handled client-server communication for file upload/download with fault tolerance.

projects.name: Fully Autonomous Robot in Python
projects.summary: Programmed a TIAGo Robot to autonomously scan, map, and retrieve objects from a simulated 3D supermarket using LiDAR-based mapping.
highlights: Achieved 90% accuracy in LiDAR-based mapping.
Developed a 2D map representation for navigation and path planning.
Implemented Color Blob Detection for object identification.
Applied RRT algorithm for optimal path computation.
Controlled the robot's arm using Inverse Kinematics for object retrieval.

volunteer.summary: Demonstrated leadership, teamwork, and discipline as a committed player in Division 1 Rugby, contributing to both practice and game strategies. Played Outside Center (13) for 15s.

Held weekly office hours (6 hrs/week) to provide academic support to peers, helping them understand challenging C++ topics. Facilitated collaborative learning and encouraged problem-solving by breaking down complex concepts.
Participated in workshops and networking events to promote professional development among Hispanic students in STEM.

Led the football team by organizing and conducting weekly practice drills, focusing on core skills development. Implemented a mentorship program pairing freshmen with seniors to promote team unity and leadership.

volunteer.position: Volunteer at Timberline Adult Day Care Services
volunteer.summary: Was part of a small group of selected students that was part of the Intergenerational Story Telling Project.
Formed part of the coaching staff for the youth football team for kids 9 to 10 years old.

skills.name: Web Development & Development Tools
keywords: Languages & Frontend: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React
Backend & Web Frameworks: Flask, Node.js, Express.js
Containerization & DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions (CI/CD)
Web Security: HTTPS, CORS, CSRF, XSS
Software Design: Object-Oriented Programming, Modular Architecture
Agile Practices: Scrum, Jira, Code Reviews
Performance: Caching, Load Balancing, Asynchronous Processing

skills.name: Machine Learning, Analytics
keywords: Data Analysis: Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn
Data Processing: ETL, Data Cleaning, Feature Engineering
Statistical Analysis: Hypothesis Testing, Regression Analysis
Algorithms: KNN, SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Neural Networks

skills.name: Networking
keywords: Protocols: TCP/IP, UDP, IPv4/IPv6, DNS, DHCP, NAT
Network Programming: Socket Programming (TCP/UDP), Multi-threaded Servers
Reliability Mechanisms: Packet Retransmission, Windowing, Congestion Control
Systems & Architecture: LAN/WAN, Proxy Servers, Load Balancing
Tools & Concepts: Wireshark, Netcat, Port Scanning, Firewalls

skills.name: Embedded & Robotics Frameworks
keywords: Sensors & Perception: LiDAR, IMU, GPS, RGB Cameras
Control Systems: PID, Extended Kalman Filter (EKF)
